intro: Eremogone graminifolia, commonly known as the desert grass or narrowleaf eremogone, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open, disturbed soils and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient environments. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and minimal water requirements. Eremogone graminifolia plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
